forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind 12 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 61. West southwest wind 10 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph.

weather_report:
As evening descends on Downtown San Francisco, the city is embraced by a veil of mostly cloudy skies, where looming clouds mingle with the last whispers of daylight. The temperature hovers around a cool 52 degrees, reminiscent of the tantalizing chill that lingers off the bay. The wind carries with it a briskness, blowing from the west-southwest at a steady pace, lending a playful edge to an otherwise tranquil atmosphere. 

Tomorrow promises a reprieve from the current cloudiness, transitioning to a mostly sunny day where the forecasted high of 61 invites residents outdoors. Patchy fog may linger stubbornly in certain places, particularly near the coastal regions, hinting at the marine layer that gently cloaks the Golden Gate. A sensible choice in attire would include layers—perhaps a light jacket to fend off the evening chill and a sweater for the afternoon sun. As night falls, one might find pleasure in a leisurely stroll along the waterfront, sipping a warm drink and appreciating the ethereal beauty of the fog-kissed city before returning to the cozy embrace of home.
